definitions.definition: Subsequently to; following in time ; later than.
examples: We had a few beers after the game.
The time is a quarter after eight.
The Cold War began shortly after WWII .
After you with the salt and pepper.

subdefinitions.definition: Subsequently to and as a result of.
examples: After your bad behaviour, you will be punished.
I’m not putting you in charge again after the last disaster.

subdefinitions.definition: Subsequently to and in spite of .
examples: After all that has happened, he is still my friend.
I can’t believe that, after all our advice against gambling, you walked into that casino!

subdefinitions.definition: Subsequently to the actions of (someone), in order to remedy a situation.
examples: I'm tired of picking up after you. Why can't you clean your own messes?
labels: often with verbs related to cleaning or tidying
subdefinitions.label_groups: often with verbs related to cleaning or tidying

subdefinitions.definition: Repeatedly , seemingly in a sequence without end.
examples: day after day, time after time, mile after mile, beer after beer, smile after smile

subdefinitions.definition: Used to indicate recent completion of an activity.
examples: I was after finishing my dinner when there was a knock on the door. [ = I had just finished my dinner when ... ]
labels: usually preceded by a form of be
followed by an -ing form of a verb
subdefinitions.label_groups: Ireland , Newfoundland , usually preceded by a form of be , followed by an -ing form of a verb

examples: He will leave a trail of destruction after him.
I told her to shut the door after her.
He’s after a job; run after him; inquire after her health.

definitions.definition: In allusion to, in imitation of; following or referencing .
examples: We named him after his grandfather.
This painting is after Leonardo da Vinci.

definitions.definition: Below, often next below, in importance or rank .
examples: The princess is next in line to the throne after the prince.

definitions.definition: Denoting the aim or object ; concerning ; in relation to.
examples: to look after workmen; to enquire after a friend; to thirst after righteousness

definitions.definition: According to the direction and influence of; in proportion to; befitting.

main_definition: Subsequently to; following in time ; later than.
secondary_definitions: In allusion to, in imitation of; following or referencing .
Below, often next below, in importance or rank .
Denoting the aim or object ; concerning ; in relation to.
( obsolete ) According to (an author or text).
( obsolete ) According to the direction and influence of; in proportion to; befitting.
